code.title: Code
code.description: Identifier assigned by the customer or buyer for internal routing purposes.

identities.title: Identities
identities.description:
Any additional Codes, IDs, SKUs, or other regional or custom
identifiers that may be used to identify the order.

period.title: Period
period.description:
Period of time that the invoice document refers to often used in addition to the details
provided in the individual line items.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: Party who is responsible for issuing payment, if not the same as the customer.

seller.title: Seller
seller.description: Seller is the party liable to pay taxes on the transaction if not the same as the supplier.

purchases.title: Purchase Orders
purchases.description: Purchase orders issued by the customer or buyer.

sales.title: Sales Orders
sales.description: Sales orders issued by the supplier or seller.

tender.title: Tender Advice
tender.description: Tender advice, the identification of the call for tender or lot the invoice relates to.

Ordering.description: Ordering provides additional information about the ordering process including references to other documents and alternative parties involved in the order-to-delivery process.

$addons.title: Addons
$addons.description:
Addons defines a list of keys used to identify tax addons that apply special
normalization, scenarios, and validation rules to a document.

$tags.title: Tags
$tags.description:
Tags are used to help identify specific tax scenarios or requirements that will
apply changes to the contents of the invoice. Tags by design should always be optional,
it should always be possible to build a valid invoice without any tags.

oneOf.title: Payment
oneOf.description:
A payment receipt sent from the supplier to a customer indicating that they have
received a transfer of funds from the customer directly or a payer.
This is the default receipt type and may be required by some tax
regimes in order to communicate the payment of specific documents and invoices.

oneOf.title: Remittance
oneOf.description:
A remittance advice sent from the customer to the supplier reflecting that payment for
the referenced documents has been made.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of receipt document being issued.

method.title: Method
method.description: Details on how the payment was made based on the original instructions.

series.title: Series
series.description: Used as a prefix to group codes.

code.title: Code
code.description: Sequential code used to identify this payment in tax declarations.

value_date.title: Value Date
value_date.description: When the taxes of this payment become accountable, if none set, the issue date is assumed.

exchange_rates.title: Exchange Rates
exchange_rates.description: Exchange rates to be used when converting the payment's monetary values into other currencies.

ext.title: Extensions
ext.description: Extensions for additional codes that may be required.

preceding.title: Preceding Details
preceding.description: Key information regarding previous versions of this document.

supplier.title: Supplier
supplier.description: The taxable entity who is responsible for supplying goods or services.

customer.title: Customer
customer.description: Legal entity that receives the goods or services.

payee.title: Payee
payee.description: Legal entity that receives the payment if not the supplier.

lines.title: Lines
lines.description: List of documents that are being paid for.

ordering.title: Ordering
ordering.description:
Ordering allows for additional information about the ordering process including references
to other documents and alternative parties involved in the order-to-delivery process.

tax.title: Tax
tax.description:
Summary of the taxes applied to the payment for tax regimes that require
this information to be communicated.

total.title: Total
total.description:
Total amount to be paid in this receipt, either positive or negative according to the
line types and totals.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description:
Unstructured information that is relevant to the receipt, such as correction or additional
legal details.

complements.title: Complements
complements.description: Additional complementary objects that add relevant information to the receipt.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: Additional semi-structured data that doesn't fit into the body of the invoice.

Receipt.description: A Receipt is used to link an invoice or invoices with a payment transaction.

document.title: Document
document.description: The document reference related to the payment.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: Currency used for the payment if different from the document currency.

debit.title: Debit
debit.description: Amount received by the supplier for ordinary payments.

credit.title: Credit
credit.description: Amount received by the customer in case of refunds.

tax.title: Tax
tax.description:
Tax total breakdown from the original document, only if required by a specific tax regime
or addon.

total.title: Total
total.description:
Total balance to be paid for this line from the customer to the supplier
in the currency of the document.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description:
Set of specific notes for this line that may be required for
clarification.

ReceiptLine.description: ReceiptLine defines the details of a line required in an invoice.
